title: 109_hr4332
content: Extension of Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002. Extension of Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 includes automatic one-year extension for crop programs to cover 2008 crop year and conditional additional year extension if President does not submit implementing legislation for Doha Development Round by January 15, 2008. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is extended to cover the 2008 and 2009 crop years and crops of the same commodity. References to July 31, 2008, in certain sections of the Act are deemed to be July 31, 2010. Other direct spending programs and authorities are subject to an automatic one-year extension. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is extended to cover the 2008 and 2009 crop years. References to 2007 in certain programs are changed to 2008. If the President doesn't submit legislation for the Doha Development Round by January 15, 2008, there will be a one-year extension for direct spending programs. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is extended to cover the 2008 and 2009 crop years. References to 2007 in certain programs are changed to 2008, with funding levels remaining the same for both years. Every authorization of appropriations in the Act is automatically extended for one year if no legislation is submitted for the Doha Development Round by January 15, 2008. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is extended to cover the 2008 and 2009 crop years. References to 2007 in certain programs are changed to 2008, with funding levels remaining the same for both years. If no legislation is submitted for the Doha Development Round by January 15, 2008, authorizations of appropriations in the Act are automatically extended for one year. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is extended to cover the 2008 and 2009 crop years. References to 2007 in certain programs are changed to 2008, with funding levels remaining the same for both years. Peanut storage costs under section 1307(a)(6) are exempt from this extension.
